intro: Eutaxia lasiocalyx, commonly known as the rough-leaved eutaxia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The leaves are typically rough to the touch, with a distinctive bluish-green color and serrated edges. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and rocky habitats.
